pinyin: dian4 nao3 fu3 zhu4 jiao4 cai2

sentences.english: He chose history as his major course of study and, upon graduation, stayed on as a teaching assistant in the university's Department of Ethnology.
sentences.chinese: 他选择了历史专业，并于毕业后留在民族学系任助教。

sentences.english: Assistantships are just jobs paid with money or free classes.
sentences.chinese: 研究生助教奖学金是支付金钱或者免费课程的工作。

sentences.english: The professor the lecture hall by several assistant teachers.
sentences.chinese: 教授在几位助教的陪同下走进了报告厅。

sentences.english: And especially TAs, that happens a lot with TAs
sentences.chinese: 特别是助教，在助教身上这种事情很常发生。

sentences.english: And especially TAs, that happens a lot with TAs
sentences.chinese: 特别是助教，在助教身上这种事情很常发生。

sentences.english: Case write-ups are to be submitted to the T. A. before the class when they are due.
sentences.chinese: 案例文章应在截止日上课之前递交助教。

sentences.english: When I was an assistant teacher, I dreaded the days when the head teacher was sick.
sentences.chinese: 当我还是一名助教时，我最害怕班主任生病。

sentences.english: A good example a university job like a teaching or research asistanshipresearch assistantship.
sentences.chinese: 在大学任助教或助理研究员就是个不错的例子。

sentences.english: Drop in during TA office hours.
Your assistantship is for one year, then how about the following years?
sentences.chinese: 您的助教为一年，那么又如何？

sentences.english: Pre k - 6Th grade tutor, after school service.
sentences.chinese: 小学生家助教，爱心，优良环境。

sentences.english: Thank you for admission and granting financial assistance of teaching assistantship.
sentences.chinese: 感谢贵校录取并提供助教奖学金。

sentences.english: The Danish teaching assistants visit Forbidden City and Temple of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 丹麦助教参观故宫博物馆和天坛公园。

sentences.english: Only full-time graduate are eligible for interships.
sentences.chinese: 只有全日制研究生才有资格获得助教薪金。

sentences.english: Your papers will be graded by a small army of TAs.
sentences.chinese: 给你们论文评分是一小队助教。

definition: to teach/to be a teacher/to train/to coach
foreign teacher (abbr. for 外國教師|外国教师)/greenhorn/novice/amateurish/religion other than Buddhism (term used by Buddhists)
to finish class/to get out of class
to give classes/to work as a teacher
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to train together/to practice as a group
